CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Total Energy Generated stage positioned above or below the Billed Consumption stage?
SRP.A: The Total Energy Generated stage is positioned {above} the Billed Consumption stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Post-Generation?
VE.A: The value of stage Post-Generation is {68096}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Billed Consumption?
VE.A: The value of stage Billed Consumption is {23387}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Total Energy Generated, with a value of {79638}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Paid Consumption, with a value of {14116}.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Total Energy Generated to stage Post-Generation?
SC.A: Decreased by {11542} Megawatt Hours from stage Total Energy Generated to stage Post-Generation.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Billed Consumption to stage Paid Consumption?
SC.A: Decreased by {9271} Megawatt Hours from stage Billed Consumption to stage Paid Consumption.

SC.Q: How much did it decrease from stage Delivered to End Users to stage Billed Consumption?
SC.A: Decreased by {11862} Megawatt Hours from stage Delivered to End Users to stage Billed Consumption.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 62429? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Total Energy Generated} stage has {79638}, the {Post-Generation} stage has {68096}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 29318? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Billed Consumption} stage has {23387}, the {Paid Consumption} stage has {14116}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 40756 and 51513? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Billed Consumption to Paid Consumption, or from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Post-Distribution} to {Delivered to End Users} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Delivered to End Users to Billed Consumption, from stage Post-Generation to Post-Transmission, or from stage Post-Distribution to Delivered to End Users?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Delivered to End Users} to stage {Billed Consumption} is the greatest.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Delivered to End Users} and {Billed Consumption} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Billed Consumption} and {Paid Consumption} stages.
